sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy continued his tour of North America, touching down in Ottawa to meet Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In response to Zelenskyy's appeal for more help to stave off Russia's invasion, Trudeau pledged more than 450 million euros over three years for 50 armoured vehicles to be built in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On Friday, Ukraine launched missile attacks on the headquarters of Russia's Black Sea fleet in Crimea, annexed by Moscow in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian authorities reported that one person was missing and that no one had been injured in the attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the ground, residents in Ukraine's eastern city of Kherson were left wading through the destruction after a Russian missile attack left at least three people dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to Ukrainian authorities, most of the 40 Russian missiles fired were shot down, causing debris to fall on civilian structures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Those seeking better lives in Italy must now pay a deposit of almost 5,000 euros to avoid detention while their asylum application is examined.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The measure was announced by the government on Friday, promising to generate controversy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This has been a record year for migrant arrivals in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is estimated that nearly 133,000 who have arrived in Italy has increased by nearly 133,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The number of people who have arrived in Italy has almost doubled last year and tripled in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The government says it will also increase the amount of time people could be detained, from three months to 18.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Currently, those who apply for asylum in Italy are free to move within the country while their application is reviewed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Human rights groups have attacked the move, saying they are looking to make detention the norm for those fleeing war and poverty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Commission's executive vice president for the economy has begun a four-day visit to China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the Bund Summit in Shanghai, Valdis Dombrovskis called for a more balanced trade relationship with the world's second largest economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Citing the EU's trade deficit of almost 400 billion euro per year with China as an example of inequality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: euro per year with China as an example of inequality our long-term interest is to embrace reforms and stay open to international cooperation here we see China as an important partner one with whom the EU wishes to work towards a more balanced trade and investment relationship Dombrovski says the European Union's recent strategy maximizes the benefits of openness while de-risking insisting that the EU had no intention of decoupling from China and also called on Beijing to broaden access for foreign businesses the executive vice president will next travel to Beijing where he is expected to discuss the EU inquiry into Chinese electric cars Pope Francis challenged French President Emmanuel Macron and other us the EU inquiry into Chinese electric cars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis challenged French President Emmanuel Macron and other European leaders to open their ports to people fleeing hardship and poverty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For a second day straight in the southern port city of Marseille, Francis took aim at EU countries that have tried to close their doors to migrants and tried to shame them into responding with charity instead. e provare a rispondere con la carità. Chi rischia la vita in mare non invade, cerca accoglienza, cerca vita.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Quanto all'emergenza, il fenomeno migratorio non è tanto un'urgenza momentanea, sempre buona per divampare propagande allarmiste, ma un dato di fatto dei nostri tempi. January, and over 2,300 died in the Mediterranean between January and June this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: More than a thousand people marching in the streets of London, wanting to rejoin the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators waved European Union flags in the second national reunion rally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They're calling for Britain to rejoin the bloc with signs reading Brexit was never going to work and Tories out rejoin the EU. The protesters are asking to put re-entry into the EU on the agenda the same day when political party conference season opens in the UK ahead of a general election expected next year.
